div.p: A concept map defines a mapping from a concept defined in one system to one or more concepts defined in other systems. A concept map maps many concepts from the same source system in a hierarchical tree. The hierarchy is purely for presentation convenience - it can be used to match the hierarchy of the concepts defined in the source system, or can also be used to group mappings into similar groups for ease of management purposes. The hierarchy has no meaning for mapping purposes.

Further discussion of the issues involved in mapping between concept definition systems can be found in the HL7 v3 Core Principles document and the functionality described in the OMG CTS 2 specification.
